newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson says mobile prices steady.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson says mobile prices steady.

text.p: Swedish telecoms company L.M. Ericsson said on Thursday mobile telephone prices had remained more stable than the company believed would happen during the first half of 1997.

"On the whole we have managed to keep our margins in good shape. Price stability on mobile telephones has been better than we thought and increased volumes coupled with good margins has given us a good profit," Ericsson Managing Director Lars Ramqvist told Reuters.
Ramqvist said the company's operating margin had also risen considerably.
He said the fact that the result was much better than analysts' expectations had nothing to do with complicated issues.

"The answer is simple. A bigger and higher sales rate, mainly within mobile telephones and mobile systems. We are still stuggling with Infokom," he said. -- Simon Haydon, Stockholm newsroom +46-8-700-1004
